name: William Holden Movies Trivia Quiz | William Holden | 10 Questions

questions.text: One of Holden's best movies is "Stalag 17". How does it end?
options: Holden escapes but another prisoner is captured
Holden and another prisoner are caught while trying to escape
Holden gives himself up so that another prisoner may escape
questions.explanation:
Holden escapes with another prisoner.

	Holden escapes with the "rich kid" soldier. Excellent movie.

questions.text: Which of these "disaster" movies included Holden in the cast?
questions.explanation:
The Towering Inferno.

	Paul Newman and Steve McQueen, too. Quite a cast.

questions.text: Holden was one of the stars of "The Horse Soldiers". Who else starred in the movie?
questions.explanation:
John Wayne.

	Wayne's "pure soldier" plays against Holden's cynicism. Not bad.

questions.text: Holden starred in "Golden Boy" and "The Country Girl". Both movies were based on plays. Who was the author of both plays?
questions.explanation:
Clifford Odets.

	Both were good plays that became good movies. "Golden" also starred Barbara Stanwyck; "Girl" included fine jobs by Grace Kelly and Bing Crosby. Inge wrote "Picnic", which also became a Holden movie.

questions.text: Which western does NOT include Holden in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Major Dundee.

	Dundee stars Charlton Heston. "Bunch" is a well-knwon Sam Peckinpah movie in the later days of Holden's career. The other two are less well-known.

questions.text: Holden starred in "Bridge On The River Kwai". Who was the director?
questions.explanation:
David Lean.

	Considered a classic by many.

Kim Novak.

	Another role with Holden as something of a misfit. From the William Inge play.

questions.text: Holden may be best known for his role in "Sunset Boulevard". Who co-starred as an aging movie queen?
questions.explanation:
Gloria Swanson.

	Swanson does a fine job late in her career as faded movie star Norma Desmond.

questions.text: Who co-starred with William Holden in "Sabrina"?
questions.explanation:
Humphrey Bogart.

	Audrey Hepburn in the title role.

questions.text: Which is NOT a movie that includes William Holden in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Strangers When We Meet.

	That one was Kirk Douglas. "Fedora" was late in Holden's career. "Toko-Ri" was a war movie with Mickey Rooney (among others). "Suite" included Barbara Stanwyck in the cast - she was his co-star in "Golden Boy".
